speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Welcome to the Batch Studio. This is your non-linear editor for audio, designed for producing complex scenes with multiple lines and voices.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can add different script blocks using the buttons at the bottom. Each block can be configured independently, with its own engine, voice, and text.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: For example, you could have the first block be a line from Vivian in the Custom engine, and the second block be a line from a voice you cloned.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The 'Auto-Switch' checkbox is the key to automation. When checked, the application will automatically load the correct A I model for each block in your sequence when you run the scene.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: For very large projects, you can click on the header of any block to collapse it. This helps keep your workspace clean and manageable.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can save and load your entire scene at any time using the file menu, allowing you to work on large projects over multiple sessions.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Next, we will discuss the review and export process within the Batch Studio. Please load chapter twelve.
